nodes.bodyText: Sure, that sounds good. Created #1387 to make this case globally rather than case by case.

Is there any chance for the denominator (return value of the below method) to be 0?
clusterModel.capacityWithAllowedReplicaMovesFor(resource, optimizationOptions);

TL;DR. Yes, and that is expected and acceptable for cluster model stats.
--
Model stats for resource utilization presents min, max, std, and average. Division by zero makes the average and the std infinity. This can happen when the cluster has no load to balance. ExcludedBrokersForReplicaMoveTest has test cases that triggers this scenario (e.g. please see tid=2 for resource distribution goals).
I'd prefer not using the proposed approach -- please see my answer on when I think we should use the final keyword.
Nit: Maybe it's a personal preference. But I'd name this variable numBalancedAllowedReplocaMoveBrokers
Since we are counting the number of balanced brokers in _brokersAllowedReplicaMove, I'd prefer to keep the current name.
I think we should change the comment to be Expected to look optimized (drop the "Not")
